chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
items.plainText: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

items.text: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
items.plainText: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.

items.text: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
items.plainText: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.

items.text: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.
items.plainText: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

items.text: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
items.plainText: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.

items.text: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.
items.plainText: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

items.text: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.
items.plainText: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

items.text: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.
items.plainText: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

items.text: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.
items.plainText: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.

items.text: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.
items.plainText: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

items.text: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:
items.plainText: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

items.text: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.
items.plainText: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.

items.text: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.
items.plainText: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

items.text: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
items.plainText: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

items.text: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?
items.plainText: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

items.text: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?
items.plainText: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?

items.text: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?
items.plainText: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?

items.text: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?
items.plainText: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?

items.text: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.
items.plainText: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

items.text: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.
items.plainText: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

items.text: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.
items.plainText: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

items.text: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.
items.plainText: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

items.text: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.
items.plainText: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

items.text: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
items.plainText: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
